intro: Ichnanthus pallens var. pallens, commonly known as the pale ichnanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement, with a distinctive oval shape. It prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species for both ecological and horticultural studies.
